intro: Isometrum crenatum, commonly known as the serrated isometrum, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, serrated leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white or pale purple, often blooming in late spring to early summer. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
